data_integrity.description: How strictly the institution limits itself to lawful, relevant, and minimally intrusive data sources.

constitutional_alignment.description: Whether underwriting rules respect federal supremacy, the right to travel, and limits on state police power.

access_fairness.description: Whether similarly situated applicants are treated alike, without unlawful DMV/DOT-based discrimination.

economic_impact.description: Estimated effect on employment, earnings, and community-level GDP when barriers are in place.

institution_types.name: Bank
institution_types.notes: Traditional depository institution offering auto and personal loans.

institution_types.name: Credit Union
institution_types.notes: Member-owned lender, often with community or employer fields of membership.

institution_types.name: Auto Finance Company
institution_types.notes: Specialized auto lender including subprime and near-prime lenders.

institution_types.name: Dealership / Buy-Here-Pay-Here
institution_types.notes: Dealer-originated financing, including on-lot payment models.

institution_types.name: Fintech / Online Lender
institution_types.notes: App- or web-based lender using algorithmic or alternative credit models.

institution_types.name: Other / Mixed
institution_types.notes: Catch-all type for blended or atypical institutions.

dmv_prohibited_uses.description: Using DMV records to deny or price credit for non–DOT-regulated citizens.
Requiring a valid state license as a condition to apply or fund a loan, where the purpose is non-commercial travel.
Transforming traffic citations into risk scores for non-commercial credit eligibility.
Importing enforcement outcomes from MCSAP/FMCSR regimes into consumer credit models.

dot_prohibited_contexts.description: Applying rules intended for DOT-regulated safety-sensitive positions to general consumers.
Treating CDL or FMCSA safety records as general-purpose risk flags outside of commercial driving work.

narrative_templates.high_risk: This institution shows severe dependency on unlawful DMV/DOT data for non-commercial credit decisions. CCRI classifies it as HIGH RISK for constitutional and consumer harm.
narrative_templates.moderate_risk: This institution exhibits mixed practices. Some data uses and gating rules diverge from constitutional and federal boundaries. CCRI classifies it as MODERATE RISK and a candidate for targeted policy corrections.
narrative_templates.low_risk: This institution relies primarily on lawful and relevant financial data. DMV/DOT contamination is low or absent. CCRI classifies it as LOW RISK, with remaining improvements focused on transparency and appeals.
